intro: Dortmanna lutea var. euphrasioides, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often hairy, while the flowers are yellow or orange with prominent stamens. It produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
